data.title: PhysicsConvexCastResult
data.body:
PhysicsRaycastResult is missing the result's fraction from convex casts, which should return PhysicsConvexCastResult instead.

PhysicsConvexCastResult just needs to derive from PhysicsRaycastResult and add fraction float from Bullet's result:

```
btCollisionWorld::ClosestConvexResultCallback::m_closestHitFraction
```

The result fraction is important because the start to end fraction can't be deduced from the result position, since it could be anywhere on the shape, and won't be at the center.

Both SphereCast and ConvexCast need to return a PhysicsConvexCastResult.

To illustrate:
![convexcast fraction](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7088062/12005430/ac79d898-abad-11e5-984d-34311392c27d.png)

data.title: Write all CMake definitons to header file
data.body:
https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/issues/1065

It is a first try (there are some issues). Any feedback?

Sample result (Config.h)

```
#pragma once

#define URHO3D_MINIDUMPS
#define URHO3D_FILEWATCHER
#define URHO3D_PROFILING
#define URHO3D_LOGGING
#define URHO3D_THREADING
#define URHO3D_ANGELSCRIPT
#define URHO3D_LUA
#define TOLUA_RELEASE
#define URHO3D_NAVIGATION
#define URHO3D_NETWORK
#define URHO3D_PHYSICS
#define URHO3D_URHO2D
#define _CRT_SECURE_NO_WARNINGS

#ifdef _MSC_VER
#    ifdef _DEBUG
#        pragma comment(lib, "Urho3D_d")
#    else
#        pragma comment(lib, "Urho3D")
#    endif
#    pragma comment(lib, "user32")
#    pragma comment(lib, "gdi32")
#    pragma comment(lib, "winmm")
#    pragma comment(lib, "imm32")
#    pragma comment(lib, "ole32")
#    pragma comment(lib, "oleaut32")
#    pragma comment(lib, "version")
#    pragma comment(lib, "uuid")
#    pragma comment(lib, "ws2_32")
#    pragma comment(lib, "winmm")
#    pragma comment(lib, "dbghelp")
#    pragma comment(lib, "opengl32")
#endif
```

data.title: AssetImporter cannot import DAE file with skeleton animation
data.body:
I use AssetImporter to import a DAE scene with character that contains skeleton animation as a node. The character cannot show up in the engine. I open the node.xml and change the component type to StaticModel then the character shows up. Is this a know issue or Am I missing something? Is the animation information already embedded in the node.xml or the mdl?
If I use AssetImporter to import the single character with skeleton animation as model, then both the character.mdl and character.ani are created and loaded successfully in the engine. 
And what is the recommended way to import the scene and the animated character into Urho3D? 
The DAE file is a little big. I can attach it if needed.

data.title: Travis CI VM running out of disk space when packaging for iOS 64bit
Editor: fix sharp edges, when UI opacity == 1.0
data.body: May be using it as default value? This method of blending is used almost always but it's easy to forget about. A similar bug https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/issues/799

data.title: JSON value fix
data.body: Fixed bug that caused a crash when setting a JSONValue to a VariantVector; previous behavior attempted to assign to indices beyond the bounds of the array. Now appropriate space is reserved and accessed.

data.title: added node tags
data.body:
Implemented a simple node tag system.
Nodes can set a stringhash as a tag and the scene caches the nodes with the same tags. If you want to get the string of the tag you have to register the name in the scene. 

Angelscript bindings are implemented.

TODO:
- Lua bindings
- Example

data.title: Problem installing Urho3D universal binary library
data.body:
There is a deficiency in the way we currently configure Urho3D project for iOS build. It is understandable that we cannot build for actual iPhone archs for all the sample apps due to code signing limitation. However, we can build for all archs when only building "Urho3D" library target using "Urho3D_universal" custom target. The problem is when performing a "make install". The install process is not configured to use this custom target. As the result, the Urho3D library being installed is not Mach-O universal binary but the lib is built only for iPhoneSimulator archs.

This problem is only being detected now as we now performing a new project scaffolding test with try_compile logic to verify if the library is good to go or not.

data.title: Emscripten builds deploy unnecessary/unused files?
data.body:
This is a minor note, not a bug or an issue, but just thought to mention: looking at the build output directory of Emscripten builds, I see there are two files `CoreData.pak` and `Data.pak` that exist in the output folder, but if I understand correctly, those are not actually used when running the .html, but the necessary data exists in the Emscripten VFS `.data` files already?

![files](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/225351/11956023/a064e3e0-a8bf-11e5-92c2-d865a9615ef7.jpg)

data.title: time step smoothing improvement
Optional index vertex attribute
data.body: Is it possible to request an optional integer index vertex attribute. Currently I am using UV2 first component and casting it to integer inside the shader. I am working on a custom mobile batching that needs indexing vertex attribute.  That would make it more mainstream.

data.title: pressedOffset and oldUI
data.body:
I'm planning to add a disabled state for the button.

At the same time I would change two things.

1) Currently, pressedOffset calculated relative hoverOffset, but not base ImageRect. It is very confused for me. Are there reasons that made it so?

2)  As I understand it, OldUI is not compatible with today's feature set. Should we keep it?

data.title: ImGui as secondary UI ?
data.body:
hey,
I am working on implementing ImGui into Urho3d and i noticed some forum posts about it, so i'm here...

https://github.com/svifylabs/Urho3D/tree/f_imgui

What do you think of it ? Should i make a pull request ? 
There are some TODO's open but it is working. 

First i thought about creating IMUI as a wrapper class but i decided against it. (wrong ?)
So you have to include <imgui/imgui.h> and use ImGui namespace for the ui elements. It does not matter where you call the ImGui functions as long as it between BeginFrame and EndFrame event.

Only tested Windows, so if someone can test it on other platforms ...

data.body: Implement GetNumPhysicalCPUs() and GetNumLogicalCPUs() on Emscripten, which calls to emscripten_num_logical_cores() (navigator.hardwareConcurrency API in JS when available, or a guessed "4 cores" when not)

data.title: Linking CXX executable error
data.body:
Hi all.

I think i'm getting problems linking but I have no idea how to solve it.

I'm using cmake to generate the Code::Blocks project file, but when I try to compile from Code::Blocks, I get these errors:

> recipe for target 'bin/test2' failed
> recipe for target 'CMakeFiles/test2.dir/all' failed
> recipe for target 'all' failed

If I try to compile from the terminal('make' command):

> Linking CXX executable bin/test2
> `.text._ZN6Urho3D12MemoryBufferD2Ev' referenced in section`.text._ZN6Urho3D12MemoryBufferD1Ev[_ZN6Urho3D12MemoryBufferD1Ev]' de /usr/local/lib/Urho3D/libUrho3D.a(Node.cpp.o): defined in discarded section `.text._ZN6Urho3D12MemoryBufferD2Ev[_ZN6Urho3D12MemoryBufferD5Ev]' de /usr/local/lib/Urho3D/libUrho3D.a(Node.cpp.o)
> collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
> CMakeFiles/test2.dir/build.make:136: recipe for target 'bin/test2' failed
> make[2]: **\* [bin/test2] Error 1
> CMakeFiles/Makefile2:60: recipe for target 'CMakeFiles/test2.dir/all' failed
> make[1]: **\* [CMakeFiles/test2.dir/all] Error 2
> Makefile:75: recipe for target 'all' failed
> make: **\* [all] Error 2

I tried reinstalling Urho but the problem persist.

Ubuntu MATE 15.10 (x86_64)
Installed from Urho3D-1.5-Linux-64bit-STATIC.deb

data.title: Cannot build with PCH due to compiler "PIC" flag configuration bug for Android platform
data.body:
https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/d9c412f7e87011ae8e3efa1e10568a4d234e00d1/CMake/Toolchains/android.toolchain.cmake#L1466-L1475

In the above code, when targeting API level level >= 16 with CMake version > 2.8.8 then Android/CMake toolchain will not set "PIC" flag. However, currently our build system appears to erroneously always add "PIC" flag when compiling the Urho3D library. The mismatch of the "PIC" flag causes the PCH to be rejected.

data.title: The function Start() is irreversibly changing a scene each time you press Play in the Editor
Fix narrowing conversion from int to unsigned char in jo_jpeg
data.body: Xcode 7 would not compile Urho3D because of the narrowing conversion. Changes are semantically equivalent so I don't think it would break anything.

data.title: Added PhysicsWorld::RaycastSingleSegmented()
data.body:
By segmenting a ray into several sub-rays segments, the physics engine has to check for intersection with much less rigid bodies (I assume Bullet uses AABB test).
It has big performance gain with large scenes that have a lot of rigid bodies in them, and that's quite a general case.

In my use case it more than doubled game framerate.

![ss 2015-12-13 at 03 57 03](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7088062/11768409/e13b5f12-a1d4-11e5-860f-a9f227fb7786.png)

It's missing Lua API.
A RaycastSegmented() would also be useful, and perhaps for the graphical raycast if it uses AABBs too.

data.title: D3D functions should use HRESULT to determine success
build LuaJIT by default
data.body: The Samples are now built by default, which caused Lua to be built by default.  It would be good to build LuaJIT by default as well.  The idea was raised in http://urho3d.prophpbb.com/topic1598.html and performance and reliability wise, nobody said it was a bad idea.  It reduces the number of options that most users need to worry about, which is helpful to avoid mismatches between Urho3D and downstream code compilation.  It promotes field testing of LuaJIT, which is more valuable on platforms such as Windows that don't get continuous integration testing.  The only corner cases mentioned were that iOS cannot have LuaJIT in the app store, and LuaJIT currently doesn't work with HTML5, but most Urho3D users aren't on those platforms.  It would be fairly easy to write CMake code saying if(IOS OR EMACSCRIPTEN), the latter of which seems to imply HTML5.
